caravanner.desc: You are proficient in Animal Handling and with land vehicles.
caravanner.name: Caravanner

caravanner.desc: You have proficiency in Survival. In addition, you have advantage on checks made to avoid fatigue from a forced march.
caravanner.name: Long Hauler

caravanner.desc: You can create a ramshackle version of a cart or wagon with 30 minutes of work if you have access to raw or reclaimed materials. Ramshackle vehicles created in this way function identically to their normal counterparts, except their gold piece value is always 0, they have half as many hit points as their normal counterparts, and they break and become useless if they are hit by any attack roll with a result of natural 20.
caravanner.name: Mobile Living

caravanner.desc: When you or a mount you're riding uses the Dash action or a vehicle you're driving uses the Ahead Full action, you can move through spaces occupied by creatures with a size category smaller than you, or your mount, or the vehicle. Creatures moved through in this way make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, creatures are knocked prone and take an amount of bludgeoning damage equal to your level. Creatures cannot be damaged twice from the same trampling charge. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or rest.
caravanner.name: Trampling Charge

caravanner.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
caravanner.name: Languages

circusfolk.desc: You can use the Disengage action as a bonus action.
circusfolk.name: Rapid Escape

circusfolk.desc: You are proficient with improvised weapons, and improvised weapons you use can deal 1d6 damage rather than the damage they normally deal. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your improvised weapons.
circusfolk.name: Slapstick

circusfolk.desc: You can cast [i]disguise self[/i] once per rest. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
circusfolk.name: Trickster's Veil

circusfolk.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common.
circusfolk.name: Languages

collegiate.desc: Once between rests, at the start of your turn you can suppress the effects of an enchantment spell you are under for 1 round as your logic overrides it.
collegiate.name: Philosophic Mind

collegiate.desc: You are proficient with calligrapher's supplies and two other artisan's tools.
collegiate.name: Practiced Artisan

collegiate.desc: You have extensive knowledge in certain fields. For all skill proficiencies gained through this trait, you always choose which ability score to use for these rolls (Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma).
collegiate.name: Studied Discipline

collegiate.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and three additional languages.
collegiate.name: Languages

cosmopolitan.desc: You gain an expertise die on checks made to persuade others to let you remain armed or to conceal weapons or items about your person.
cosmopolitan.name: Discreetly Armed

cosmopolitan.desc:
After you spend at least 1 minute observing a creature within 60 feet, you can use an action to make either an Insight or History check against a DC equal to the creature's passive Deception check score. On a success, you learn the following information about that creature:

[ul bullet=*]* Whether the creature has a lower Charisma score than yourself.
* The creature's culture and national origin (if any).
* The creature's social standing in the local majority culture.[/ul]
cosmopolitan.name: Fashion Sense

cosmopolitan.desc: You gain proficiency in Culture and one other skill of your choice.
cosmopolitan.name: Skill Versatility

cosmopolitan.desc: You can make an Investigation check to learn the location of (or at the Narrator's discretion gain a helpful clue to the trail of) a person by discreetly asking around in the right places. The difficulty of the check is DC 15 if the individual is not hiding, or DC 20 if they are trying to conceal their location.
cosmopolitan.name: Urban Denizen

cosmopolitan.desc: You gain an extra connection, selected from a background of your choice. This person is of a different heritage or national origin than yourself.
cosmopolitan.name: Well-Connected

cosmopolitan.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign in Common and two additional languages.
cosmopolitan.name: Languages

deepdwarf.desc: You have darkvision to 60 feet, or the range of your existing darkvision increases by 60 feet.
deepdwarf.name: Superior Darkvision

deepdwarf.desc: You know the [i]resistance[/i] cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]jump[/i] once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]enlarge/reduce[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, but you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight (although sunlight has no effect on them once cast). Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
deepdwarf.name: Deep Magic

deepdwarf.desc: You gain an expertise die on Wisdom saving throws against illusions and against being charmed or frightened.
deepdwarf.name: Deep Suspicion

deepdwarf.desc: You are proficient with hand crossbows, short swords, and war picks.
deepdwarf.name: Underground Combat Training

deepdwarf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Dwarvish, and Undercommon.
deepdwarf.name: Languages

deepgnome.desc: You have darkvision to 60 feet, or the range of your existing darkvision increases by 60 feet.
deepgnome.name: Superior Darkvision

deepgnome.desc: You can cast [i]disguise self[/i] once per rest. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]blindness/deafness[/i] (blindness only) once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]nondetection[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, and when casting them your spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
deepgnome.name: Dark Gnome Magic

deepgnome.desc: You gain an expertise die on Stealth checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
deepgnome.name: Subterranean Camouflage

deepgnome.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Gnomish, and Undercommon.
deepgnome.name: Languages

dragonbound.desc: You gain an expertise die on Charisma checks made to influence dragon creatures.
dragonbound.name: Draconic Diplomacy

dragonbound.desc: You know one cantrip of your choice from the cleric or wizard spell lists. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence or Wisdom (whichever is highest).
dragonbound.name: Dragonbound Teachings

dragonbound.desc:
Choose a type of boon.

[b]Chromatic Dragon's Boon[/b]
You can cast [i]fear[/i] without the need for material components once per rest. Until you reach 5th level, the area of this casting of the spell is limited to a 15-foot cone. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Charisma.

[b]Essence Dragon's Boon[/b]
You know the [i]druidcraft[/i] cantrip. In addition, your diplomatic understanding extends towards the creatures of the land and the spirits within it. You gain an expertise die on Charisma checks made to influence beast and celestial creatures.

[b]Gem Dragon's Boon[/b]
You know the [i]message[/i] cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]illusory script[/i] once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]invisibility[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, and when casting them your spellcasting ability is Intelligence or Charisma (whichever is highest).

[b]Metallic Dragon's Boon[/b]
Choose a skill from among Arcana, History, Medicine, Nature, or Religion. You have proficiency in the chosen skill and you gain an expertise die on ability checks you make using it.
dragonbound.name: Progenitor's Boon

dragonbound.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Draconic.
dragonbound.name: Languages

dragoncult.desc: As a bonus action, you can cause draconic power to course around you in a draconic umbra. This draconic umbra lasts for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to end it. Once you have used this trait, you cannot use it again until after you finish a rest.
dragoncult.name: Draconic Umbra

dragoncult.desc: Choose two skills from among Arcana, Deception, Persuasion, Religion, or Stealth. You have proficiency in the chosen skills.
dragoncult.name: Secrets of the Wyrm

dragoncult.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Draconic.
dragoncult.name: Languages

eladrin.desc: You have proficiency with longswords and rapiers.
eladrin.name: Eladrin Weapon Training

eladrin.desc: In addition to being humanoid, you also have the fey creature type.
eladrin.name: Fey Sublimation

eladrin.desc:
You know one cantrip based on the aspect of nature you wish to manifest or that of your liege. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
At the end of a rest, you can change your selected aspect.

[b]Autumn[/b]: [i]resistance[/i]
[b]Hiding[/b]: [i]minor illusion[/i]
[b]Respite[/b]: [i]mending[/i]
[b]Rot[/b]: [i]chill touch[/i]
[b]Spring[/b]: [i]druidcraft[/i]
[b]Stars[/b]: [i]dancing lights[/i]
[b]Storm[/b]: [i]shocking grasp[/i]
[b]Summer[/b]: [i]produce flame[/i]
[b]Toxicity[/b]: [i]pestilence[/i]
[b]Winter[/b]: [i]ray of frost[/i]
eladrin.name: Invocation of the Eladrin Lords

eladrin.desc: You are proficient in one of the following skills: Arcana, Culture, Deception, History, Insight, Persuasion, Survival.
eladrin.name: Knowledge of the Faerie Courts

eladrin.desc: You can forego your movement on your turn to teleport 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you have used this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a rest.
eladrin.name: Twilight Step

eladrin.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign in Common, Elvish, and Sylvan.
eladrin.name: Languages

forestgnome.desc: You have proficiency with one type of artisans' tools of your choice.
forestgnome.name: Artistic Pursuits

forestgnome.desc: You can cast [i]disguise self[/i] once per rest. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]blur[/i] once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]major image[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, and when casting them your spellcasting ability is Intelligence or Wisdom (whichever is higher).
forestgnome.name: Natural Illusionist

forestgnome.desc: You have an innate ability to communicate simple thoughts and ideas with beasts of size Small or smaller.
forestgnome.name: Small Beast Speech

forestgnome.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Gnomish.
forestgnome.name: Languages

forgottenfolx.desc: As long as an ally is within 60 feet of you, you always know their general location even if you cannot see or otherwise sense them. This effect is blocked by 1 foot of lead or iron and magical effects like the [i]nondetection[/i] spell.
forgottenfolx.name: Eyes Everywhere

forgottenfolx.desc: You can use the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you do so, the range at which you can Help an ally increases to 15 feet. Once per rest when you Help an ally, in addition to granting advantage you may also choose for your ally to gain an expertise die.
forgottenfolx.name: It Takes a Village

forgottenfolx.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Gnomish, and one other language.
forgottenfolx.name: Languages

forsaken.desc: You can go a number of days equal to half your Constitution modifier without suffering any fatigue from lack of Supply.
forsaken.name: Eat Like a Bird

forsaken.desc: During a rest, when you have access to raw materials you can jury-rig an improvised tool kit. If you roll a 1 while making a check using the improvised tools or the next time you take a rest, they break.
forsaken.name: Improvised Tools

forsaken.desc: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.
forsaken.name: Pack Rat

forsaken.desc: After you fail an ability check, you have advantage on your next ability check. You can't use this trait again until you finish a short or rest.
forsaken.name: Roll With the Punches

forsaken.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, and two additional languages.
forsaken.name: Languages

godbound.desc: You are proficient with your choice of either Performance, two musical instruments, or two artisan's tools.
godbound.name: Arts of Worship

godbound.desc: You have one additional connection, selected from the Acolyte background.
godbound.name: Bonus Connection

godbound.desc:
After you speak with a person for at least 1 minute, you can use an action to make either an Insight or Religion check opposed by their Deception check. On a success, you learn the following information about them:
[ul bullet=*]* Whether they have a lower Wisdom score than yourself.
* Whether they are religious; if so, you also learn their faith.
* Whether they have class levels in the cleric or herald class.[/ul]
godbound.name: Detect Faith

godbound.desc: You gain an expertise die on saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened.
godbound.name: Devotion

godbound.desc: You are proficient in the Religion skill and know one cantrip of your choice from the cleric, druid, or herald spell list. Your spellcasting ability score for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
godbound.name: Religious Education

godbound.desc: You have advantage on checks made to socially interact with members of your current or former faith, such as when requesting services or gathering information.
godbound.name: Siblings in Faith

godbound.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign in Common and one other language.
godbound.name: Languages

highelf.desc: You can always choose to use Intelligence when making a Deception, Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion check.
highelf.name: Cunning Diplomat

highelf.desc: You are proficient in Culture and one additional skill of your choice.
highelf.name: High Elf Education

highelf.desc: You have proficiency with rapiers and longswords.
highelf.name: High Elf Weapon Training

highelf.desc: You know a cantrip of your choice, which can be chosen from any spell list. Your spellcasting ability score for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
highelf.name: Magical Versatility

highelf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign in Common, Elvish, and one other language.
highelf.name: Languages

hilldwarf.desc: You know the [i]friends[/i] cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]charm person[/i] once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]suggestion[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, and when casting them your spellcasting ability is Charisma.
hilldwarf.name: Community Magic

hilldwarf.desc: You are proficient in either Deception or Persuasion.
hilldwarf.name: Friendly

hilldwarf.desc: You are either proficient in either Animal Handling or with land vehicles.
hilldwarf.name: Wagoner

hilldwarf.desc: You are proficient in Survival and gain an expertise die on checks using it.
hilldwarf.name: Ways of the Land

hilldwarf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Dwarvish, and two additional languages.
hilldwarf.name: Languages

imperial.desc: You are proficient with light armor, spears, and light crossbows.
imperial.name: Conscript

imperial.desc: You gain proficiency in History and one other skill of your choice.
imperial.name: Learned Teachers

imperial.desc: Whenever your hit point maximum or one of your ability scores would be reduced, it is reduced by half as much instead (minimum 1).
imperial.name: Local Healers

imperial.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
imperial.name: Languages

itinerant.desc: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit.
itinerant.name: Blending In

itinerant.desc: The first time you interact with strangers in an unfamiliar land or region, you gain an expertise die to the first Charisma check you make. This trait does not work on groups if at least one person in a group knows you.
itinerant.name: Conscientious Socializer

itinerant.desc: You gain one additional connection, which you can choose from any background other than your own.
itinerant.name: I Know Someone

itinerant.desc: You gain proficiency in Culture. In addition, choose Intelligence or Wisdom. You gain an expertise die on ability checks using the chosen ability score that are made to understand the social customs of, interact with, or recall knowledge about individuals, objects, or environments associated with any culture or society you have been surrounded by for a month or longer.
itinerant.name: Many Cultures

itinerant.desc:
Choose one of the following:

[b]Homeland Seeker[/b]
You gain proficiency in Arcana and History.

[b]Labor Migrant[/b]
You are proficient with a set of artisan's tools and one skill of your choice.

[b]Shadow Exile[/b]
You are proficient in Deception or Stealth. If you pick Stealth, once between rests you can make a Stealth check to replace a Perception check. If you pick Deception, once between rests you can make a Deception check to replace an Insight check.

[b]Refugee[/b]
You are proficient in Survival, and when in an urban environment can roll Survival checks when using Intimidation or Persuasion.
itinerant.name: Motive and Reason

itinerant.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and three additional languages.
itinerant.name: Languages

kithbainhalfling.desc: You have darkvision to 60 feet, or the range of your existing darkvision increases by 60 feet.
kithbainhalfling.name: Superior Darkvision

kithbainhalfling.desc: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Perception checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
kithbainhalfling.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

kithbainhalfling.desc: You can cast [i]telepathic bond[/i] without the need for material components once per rest.
kithbainhalfling.name: The Ken

kithbainhalfling.desc: You are proficient in Insight, and you gain an expertise die on checks made with it.
kithbainhalfling.name: Without Secrets

kithbainhalfling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Halfling, and Sylvan.
kithbainhalfling.name: Languages

lonewanderer.desc: You gain four skill or tool proficiencies of your choice.
lonewanderer.name: Culture of My Own

lonewanderer.desc: Choose one weapon worth 100 gold or less. You begin play with a masterwork version of that weapon.
lonewanderer.name: Heirloom

lonewanderer.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and two additional languages.
lonewanderer.name: Languages

mountaindwarf.desc: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
mountaindwarf.name: Dwarven Weapon Training

mountaindwarf.desc: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.
mountaindwarf.name: Dwarven Armor Training

mountaindwarf.desc: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, you have proficiency in Engineering.
mountaindwarf.name: Heart of the Forge

mountaindwarf.desc: You're acclimated to high and low altitudes, including elevations above 20,000 feet or depths below 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to cold climates.
mountaindwarf.name: Mountain Born

mountaindwarf.desc: Whenever you make a History check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and gain an expertise die.
mountaindwarf.name: Stonecunning

mountaindwarf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Dwarvish, and one other language.
mountaindwarf.name: Languages

mustbairnhalfling.desc: You ignore difficult terrain caused by any form of earth or soil, such as mud, or mountainous terrain. In addition, you know the [i]druidcraft[/i] cantrip.
mustbairnhalfling.name: Child of the Soil

mustbairnhalfling.desc: You can attempt to divine the earth's wisdom (as the [i]augury[/i] spell) by submerging your feet or hands into mud or soil. You can't use this trait again until after you finish a rest.
mustbairnhalfling.name: Earthspeak

mustbairnhalfling.desc: You have the Chaotic alignment for the purposes of any spell or ability that would detect or affect Chaotic creatures. In addition, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills: Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Nature, Religion, or Survival.
mustbairnhalfling.name: Wild and Unshackled

mustbairnhalfling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Halfling, and Terran.
mustbairnhalfling.name: Languages

nomad.desc: You are proficient in Animal Handling and Survival, and either Medicine, Nature, or Perception.
nomad.name: Nature Minded

nomad.desc: You are proficient with land vehicles and tinker's tools. You can use tinker's tools to repair a land vehicle you have travelled in for at least 1 month, and gain an expertise die on any checks made to do so. Additionally, you gain an expertise die on checks made to control or navigate a land vehicle.
nomad.name: On the Road Again

nomad.desc: After observing an outside area for 1 minute, you can predict the weather within the next 24 hours. You cannot foresee magical changes, but you can use an action to make an Insight or Perception check to notice them.
nomad.name: Sense Weather

nomad.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and two additional languages.
nomad.name: Languages

settler.desc: Whenever you begin a rest, you can choose to spend the first hour of that rest making the area into a fortified position for the duration. While resting in a fortified position, the ground in a 60-foot radius area around you is considered difficult terrain for any creatures other than those you consider allies. In addition, the first time a hidden creature enters the fortified area, it makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature inadvertently makes loud noises and is no longer hidden.
settler.name: Claim Staker

settler.desc: You are proficient in the Insight and Survival skills.
settler.name: Frontier Survival

settler.desc: You gain an expertise die on any check made to determine if something is poisonous.
settler.name: Strange Forager

settler.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, and two additional languages.
settler.name: Languages

shadowelf.desc: You have darkvision to 60 feet, or the range of your existing darkvision increases by 60 feet.
shadowelf.name: Superior Darkvision

shadowelf.desc: You have proficiency with rapiers and hand crossbows.
shadowelf.name: Shadow Elf Weapon Training

shadowelf.desc: You know a cantrip: either [i]dancing lights[/i] or [i]minor illusion[/i]. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast [i]faerie fire[/i] once per rest. At 5th level, you can cast [i]darkness[/i] once per rest. You don't need material components for these spells, and when casting them your spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
shadowelf.name: Shadow Lore

shadowelf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Elvish, and Undercommon.
shadowelf.name: Languages

steamforged.desc: You have proficiency in either History, Investigation, or Nature, and you gain an expertise die on checks made using the chosen skill.
steamforged.name: Mind Like a Steel Trap

steamforged.desc: You have proficiency with tinker's tools and Engineering, plus one other artisan's tool of your choice.
steamforged.name: Tech Savvy

steamforged.desc:
Choose one of the following:

[b]Student of Martial Arts[/b]
When you replace an attack or use an action to Disarm, Grapple, Overrun, Shove, or Tumble, you gain an expertise die.

[b]Student of Martial Science[/b]
Choose one 1st degree combat maneuver from any tradition. You can use this combat maneuver once without spending exertion. You can't use it again until you finish a rest.
steamforged.name: War Scholar

steamforged.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign in Common and one other language.
steamforged.name: Languages

stoicorc.desc: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened.
stoicorc.name: Clarity of Mind

stoicorc.desc: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Arcana, History, Insight, Medicine, Nature, or Religion.
stoicorc.name: Stoic Traditions

stoicorc.desc: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice. These spells must have the ritual tag and you may only cast them as rituals. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you may cast other spells you learn as rituals if those spells have the ritual tag.
stoicorc.name: Ritualistic Focus

stoicorc.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Orc.
stoicorc.name: Languages

stoneworthy.desc:
Once between rests, you can do one of the following:

[b]Concentrate[/b]
You gain an expertise die on a Constitution saving throw made to maintain concentration.

[b]Persist[/b]
You may reattempt a failed ability check.
stoneworthy.name: Focused Patience

stoneworthy.desc: When bartering, haggling, or negotiating an exchange of goods, you gain an expertise die on Intimidation and Persuasion checks, and you may always choose which ability score to use for these rolls (Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma).
stoneworthy.name: Natural Barterer

stoneworthy.desc: Each time you gain a level, you may choose to lose proficiency in one skill or tool and gain proficiency in a different skill or tool in its place. You cannot trade a skill proficiency for a tool proficiency, and vice versa.
stoneworthy.name: Temporary Expert

stoneworthy.desc: You may spend 4 hours between rests crafting one non-metal tool or simple weapon, or five pieces of ammunition, provided you have access to the materials needed and the final cost of the items does not exceed 5 gold.
stoneworthy.name: Versatile Crafter

stoneworthy.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
stoneworthy.name: Languages

stouthalfling.desc: Whenever you begin a rest, you and up to 6 allies can each consume 1 Supply to partake in your borough cooking, gaining 1d6 temporary hit points.
stouthalfling.name: Borough Cooking

stouthalfling.desc: You gain proficiency in either Animal Handling or Nature.
stouthalfling.name: Home Gardening

stouthalfling.desc: You gain proficiency with calligrapher's supplies. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Intelligence checks to recall details about past events you took part in by first checking your journals.
stouthalfling.name: Memoirist

stouthalfling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Halfling, and one other language.
stouthalfling.name: Languages

tinkergnome.desc:
You gain proficiency with tinker's tools, Engineering, and either Arcana or History. You gain an expertise die whenever you use them to make a check related to alchemical, magical, or technological items.
By spending 1 hour and 10 gold worth of materials, you may build a clockwork device that has an AC of 5 and 1 hit point. The device will cease to function after 24 hours, or if you choose to dismantle it, unless you spend an hour maintaining it. An hour can be spent to repair a device that has ceased to function. You can have up to three devices functioning at a time.

[b]Audiophone[/b]
When started, this device plays a pre-recorded sound at a moderate volume. The device stops playing when it reaches the end of the recording, or when shut off. You can use your action to record any 1 minute of audio, and can use a bonus action to start and shut off the device.

[b]Clockwork Figure[/b]
This figure can be a Tiny animal, monster, or even a humanoid. When placed on the ground, you can use a bonus action to direct the figure to march up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice. You can choose to have the figure make a noise that is appropriate to the creature it represents, or to have it be silent. If you choose for the figure to be silent, you can instead equip it with a small flame that sheds dim light 5 feet in front of the figure.

[b]Flame Box[/b]
When a bonus action is used to activate this device it creates a small flame that can be used to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to shoot a small ball of fire from the device as a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30 feet, dealing 1d6 + 1 fire damage. You are considered proficient with the flame box. Using the device this way damages it, and it must be repaired over the course of a rest before it can be used again.

[b]Sensor[/b]
This device can be attached to a wall or any smooth, sturdy surface. When placed, it begins monitoring the area around it. Choose one sort of activity to monitor: noise or movement. The device detects these things up to 30 feet around it, including through openings, but cannot sense through total cover. The device relays the information back to you telepathically, and can share either clips of sound (limited to 30 seconds at a time, with a minimum of 10 minutes in between relays) or information on the size and number of creatures moving in the area.
tinkergnome.name: Cunning Creative

tinkergnome.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common, Gnomish, and one other language.
tinkergnome.name: Languages

tunnelhalfling.desc: You gain proficiency with one of the following skills: Acrobatics, Deception, Nature, or Stealth.
tunnelhalfling.name: Rebellious Tactics

tunnelhalfling.desc: When you are grappled, you can use your reaction to automatically escape that grapple. Once you have used this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a rest.
tunnelhalfling.name: Slippery

tunnelhalfling.desc: You gain proficiency in Sleight of Hand, and you gain an expertise die when picking a pocket or otherwise taking an item without notice.
tunnelhalfling.name: Trained Filcher

tunnelhalfling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Halfling.
tunnelhalfling.name: Languages

tyrannized.desc: You gain proficiency in either Deception or Intimidation.
tyrannized.name: All Hail the Tyrant

tyrannized.desc: You gain an expertise die on saving throws made to resist being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or put to sleep.
tyrannized.name: Defiant Will

tyrannized.desc: If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum +3), possibly changing a failure into a success. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or rest.
tyrannized.name: Saving Face

tyrannized.desc:
Choose either scars or scourge, and then choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

[b]Scars[/b]
You have resistance to the chosen damage type.

[b]Scourge[/b]
As a bonus action, you can enhance the next attack you make this turn. If that attack hits, it deals extra damage of the chosen type equal to your proficiency bonus. However, the sting of the scourge lessens after the initial strike, so after you deal this extra damage to a creature, this trait cannot deal extra damage to it during the same combat.
tyrannized.name: Scars of the Scourge

tyrannized.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
tyrannized.name: Languages

villager.desc: You gain proficiency in Animal Handling.
villager.name: Farm Life

villager.desc: You are proficient with improvised weapons.
villager.name: Sharpened Tools

villager.desc: You may always choose to use Wisdom when making History, Nature, or Religion checks. However, the Narrator may decide that the results of a check made in this way are distorted or exaggerated forms of the truth.
villager.name: Tall Tales

villager.desc: You gain an expertise die on Perception checks made while keeping watch during a rest.
villager.name: Village Watch

villager.desc: You can speak, read, sign, and write Common and one other language.
villager.name: Languages

warhordling.desc: As a bonus action, you can move up to your Speed towards an enemy that you can see or hear.
warhordling.name: Aggressive

warhordling.desc: You are proficient with two martial weapons of your choice and with light armor. You are also able to cobble together functional if somewhat ramshackle weapons from whatever you have on hand. You can create a ramshackle version of any simple weapon (except crossbows) with 10 minutes of work if you have access to simple materials such as common household items, the rusted scraps found among battlefields, or the bounty of the forest. Ramshackle weapons created in this way function identically to their normal counterparts, except their gold value is always 0 and they break and become useless if you critically fumble.
warhordling.name: War Horde Weapon Training

warhordling.desc: Once per rest, you can spend 4 hours of time to locate Supply for yourself and one other creature while traveling through urban environments, warzones, and battlefields.
warhordling.name: Wartime Scrounger

warhordling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
warhordling.name: Languages

wildling.desc:
You gain proficiency in Perception. Choose one of the following.

[b]Nightwalker[/b]
You gain an expertise die on Investigation and Perception checks made in moonlight or starlight.

[b]Sunseeing[/b]
You gain an expertise die on Investigation and Perception checks made in daylight.
wildling.name: Enhanced Vision

wildling.desc: Once per rest, you can spend 4 hours of time to locate Supply for yourself and one other creature, or magical reagents worth up to 5 gold.
wildling.name: Expert Forager

wildling.desc: By observing the environment when on your home plane, you can estimate the time of year down to within a week of the actual date. When you are outdoors, you know the time of day.
wildling.name: Internal Clock

wildling.desc:
You gain proficiency in Nature, and can always choose to use Wisdom when making a Nature check. Choose one of the following.

[b]Agriculturalist[/b]
You gain an expertise die on Persuasion checks made against farmers, horticulturalists, and those who cultivate for a living, and when making an ability check to use a land vehicle.

[b]Beastwarden[/b]
When you have a hunting animal such as a falcon or hunting dog assisting you, you gain an expertise die on checks made to hunt or track. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Animal Handling checks.

[b]Land Hunter[/b]
You gain an expertise die on Intimidation and Stealth checks. Additionally, you can march up to 12 hours before you need to save against fatigue.

[b]Water Drifter[/b]
You gain an expertise die when making an ability check to use a water vehicle. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Athletics checks, and you can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes by using an action to prepare to do so.
wildling.name: Living Off The Land

wildling.desc: Pick a terrain type. After observing the area for 1 minute, you can predict the weather in this terrain within the next 24 hours. You cannot foresee magical changes, but you can use an action to make an Insight or Perception check to notice them. When you have successfully predicted the weather, you gain an expertise die on saving throws made against its effects.
wildling.name: Weather Sense

wildling.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and one other language.
wildling.name: Languages

woodelf.desc: You can cast animal friendship without material components once per rest. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (whichever is highest).
woodelf.name: Nature's Ally

woodelf.desc:
Choose one of the following.

[b]Way with Animals[/b]
You gain proficiency with Animal Handling and with land vehicles.

[b]Way with Plants[/b]
You gain proficiency in Nature and with herbalism kits.
woodelf.name: Nature's Touch

woodelf.desc: You gain a climb speed equal to your Speed.
woodelf.name: Treeborne Scout

woodelf.desc: You are proficient with longbows and shortswords.
woodelf.name: Wood Elf Weapon Training

woodelf.desc: You can speak, read, write, and sign Common and Elvish.
woodelf.name: Languages
